org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.behaviors

Class AbstractBehavior<VR>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.gef4.mvc.behaviors.AbstractBehavior<VR>
  • Type Parameters:
    VR - The visual root node of the UI toolkit used, e.g. javafx.scene.Node in case of JavaFX.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IActivatable, IAdaptable.Bound<IVisualPart<VR,? extends VR>>, IBehavior<VR>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContentBehavior, FXConnectionClickableAreaBehavior, FXFocusBehavior, FXGridBehavior, HoverBehavior, SelectionBehavior

    public abstract class AbstractBehavior<VR>
extends java.lang.Object
implements IBehavior<VR>
    The AbstractBehavior can be used as a base class for IBehavior implementations. It implements activation and deactivation of its adapters, and provides methods for the addition and removal of feedback and handles, as well as a method that can be used to update the handles for a given target part.

      • addFeedback

        protected void addFeedback(java.util.List<? extends IVisualPart<VR,? extends VR>> targets,
                           java.util.List<? extends IFeedbackPart<VR,? extends VR>> feedback)
        Adds the given IFeedbackParts to the root part of the getHost(). Moreover, the IFeedbackParts are anchored to the given target IVisualParts.
        Parameters:
        targets - A list of IVisualParts for which feedback is added to the viewer.
        feedback - A list of IFeedbackParts that are added to the viewer.

      • addHandles

        protected void addHandles(java.util.List<? extends IVisualPart<VR,? extends VR>> targets,
                          java.util.List<? extends IHandlePart<VR,? extends VR>> handles)
        Adds the given IHandleParts to the root part of the getHost(). Moreover, the IHandleParts are anchored to the given target IVisualParts.
        Parameters:
        targets - A list of IVisualParts for which handle parts are added to the viewer.
        handles - A list of IHandleParts that are added to the viewer.

      • switchAdaptableScopes

        @Deprecated
protected void switchAdaptableScopes()
        Deprecated. The adaptable scopes are switched when the adapters are injected, therefore, the scopes do not need to be switched manually.
        Adjusts the relevant adaptable scopes to refer to the host of this behavior, it's viewer, and it's domain, respectively.

      • updateHandles

        protected IHandlePart<VR,? extends VR> updateHandles(IVisualPart<VR,? extends VR> target,
                                                     java.util.List<? extends IHandlePart<VR,? extends VR>> handles,
                                                     java.util.Comparator<IHandlePart<VR,? extends VR>> interactedWithComparator,
                                                     IHandlePart<VR,? extends VR> interactedWith)
        Updates the handle parts for the given target. Handle parts that are not equal to any handle part within the given list of handle parts are removed, and the remaining handle parts are added. Therefore, the given handle parts are the
        Parameters:
        target - The target IVisualPart for which to update the handles.
        handles - The new handles for the given target.
        interactedWithComparator - A function that computes the distance to the currently interacted with handle for the passed-in handle part. Can be null if no handle should be preserved.
        interactedWith - The IHandlePart that is currently interacted with and that should be preserved, or null.
        Returns:
        The new IHandlePart for the position of the handle part that is interacted with.
